text: Is there any way to suppress stacktraces in the REPL?  They are easier to read with 1.6, but (far) more often than not I don't care about them and they just clutter up my terminal (and cause more interesting things to scroll off screen).  It would be great if I could turn them on when needed, but leave them off by default.

elements.text: Is there any way to suppress stacktraces in the REPL?  They are easier to read with 1.6, but (far) more often than not I don't care about them and they just clutter up my terminal (and cause more interesting things to scroll off screen).  It would be great if I could turn them on when needed, but leave them off by default.

text: You could use ReplMaker.jl to make a custom repl mode that catches errors and strips the stacktrace.

elements.text: You could use ReplMaker.jl to make a custom repl mode that catches errors and strips the stacktrace.

text: Thanks, I’ll give that a try. Am I the only person that would find this useful???
